{{also|Lange|langé|länge|långe|Länge}} ==Dutch== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/ˈlɑŋə/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-lange.ogg|Audio}} ===Adjective=== {{head|nl|adjective form}} # {{nl-adj form of|infl|lang}} ===Anagrams=== * {{l|nl|algen}}, {{l|nl|angel}}, {{l|nl|lagen}}, {{l|nl|nagel}} ---- ==Estonian== ===Etymology=== {{rfe|et|Derived how?}} From {{m|et|langema}}. ===Noun=== {{et-noun|lange|langet}} # [[fall]] # [[lapse]] ====Inflection==== {{rfinfl|et|noun}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|et|väljalange}} * {{l|et|langenurk}} * {{l|et|langetõbi}} ---- ==French== ===Etymology=== [[substantivisation|Substantivization]] of {{etyl|fro|fr}} {{m|fro|lange||woollen}}, from {{etyl|la|fr}} {{m|la|laneus}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{fr-IPA|pos=vnv}} ===Noun=== {{fr-noun|m}} # flannel [[blanket]], baby blanket # {{lb|fr|in the plural}} [[swaddling clothes]] # {{a|Switzerland|Belgium}} [[diaper]], [[nappy]] ===Verb=== {{head|fr|verb form}} # {{inflection of|fr|langer||1//3|s|pres|ind//sub|;|2|s|impr}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:TLFi}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology 1=== {{inh|de|gmh|lange}}, an adverb to {{m|gmh|lanc}} ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|de|lang}} {{qualifier|for the temporal adverb}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|de|[ˈlaŋə]}} * {{audio|de|De-at-lange.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} * {{rhymes|de|aŋə}} ====Adverb==== {{de-adv}} # [[long]], [[for]] [[a]] [[long]] [[time]] #* '''1931''', [[w:Arthur Schnitzler|Arthur Schnitzler]], ''[[s:de:Flucht in die Finsternis|Flucht in die Finsternis]]'', [[w:S. Fischer Verlag|S. Fischer Verlag]], page 105: #*: Sie schwiegen '''lange'''. Als er endlich etwas sagen wollte, wehrte sie leise ab. „Heute nichts mehr, ich bitte dich darum“ #*:: They were silent for a long time. When he finally wanted to say something, she softly refused. „Nothing more today, I beg you for that“ #* '''1903''', {{w|Fanny zu Reventlow}}, ''[[s:de:Ellen Olestjerne|Ellen Olestjerne]]'', in ''Franziska Gräfin zu Reventlow: Gesammelte Werke'', Albert Langen, page 674: #*: Spät abends, als es '''lange''' dunkel war, fanden sie endlich ein Nachtquartier in einem entlegenen Dorf. #*:: Late at night, when it was long dark, they finally found a night's lodging in a remote village. # [[in]] [[a]] [[long]] [[time]] ===Etymology 2=== Inflected forms. ====Adjective==== {{head|de|adjective form}} # {{inflection of|de|lang||str//mix|nom//acc|f|s|;|str|nom//acc|p|;|wk|nom|all-gender|s|;|wk|acc|f//n|s}} ====Verb==== {{head|de|verb form}} # {{de-verb form of|langen|1|s|g}} # {{de-verb form of|langen|1|s|k1}} # {{de-verb form of|langen|3|s|k1}} # {{de-verb form of|langen|i|s}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Norwegian Bokmål== ===Adjective=== {{head|nb|adjective form}} # {{inflection of|nb|lang||def|s}} # {{plural of|nb|lang}} ---- ==Norwegian Nynorsk== ===Adjective=== {{head|nn|adjective form}} # {{definite singular of|nn|lang}} # {{plural of|nn|lang}} ---- ==Old English== ===Etymology=== {{suffix|ang|lang|e}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|ang|/ˈlɑŋ.ɡe/}} ===Adverb=== {{head|ang|adverb}} (''comparative'' '''[[leng|lenġ]]''', ''superlative'' '''[[lengest|lenġest]]''') # [[long]], for a [[long]] [[time]] ---- ==Old French== ===Adjective=== {{fro-adj|mf}} # [[woollen]]; made of wool ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Etymology=== Compare {{cog|de|langen}}. ===Verb=== {{head|pdc|verb}} # to [[hand]] #: {{ux|pdc|'''Lang''' mer's Sals.|Hand me the salt.}}
